definition: to select/(computing) to click on (one of several options)/to navigate to (a webpage)

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: It clicked off, leaving the room to her soft moans .
sentences.chinese: 它點選過，離開房間，她軟弱的呻吟。

sentences.english: Tap the ". ?123" key to switch to a numerical keyboard.
sentences.chinese: 點選“。？123”鍵切換到一個數字鍵盤。

sentences.english: Enter club page, select your club.
sentences.chinese: 進入棋社分頁，點選所屬的棋社。

sentences.english: You can double click on it to start LGC.
sentences.chinese: 滑鼠左鍵雙擊點選圖示即可啓動LGC。

sentences.english: You can easily shift the author to the student mode by pressing the mode icon.
sentences.chinese: 編寫者只要點選轉換鍵就可以很容易地回到學生模式。

sentences.english: Click here to go back to our Home page.
sentences.chinese: 點選這裏返回到兆豐國際投信的首頁。

sentences.english: Click on any source to show the inscriptions.
sentences.chinese: 點選其中一項即可顯示該拓片的搜尋結果。

sentences.english: No student had started a search by clicking on a subject category .
sentences.chinese: 沒有一個學生是開始搜尋從學科類目點選。

sentences.english: The game includes safe sex information upon clicking.
sentences.chinese: 遊戲包括可以點選的安全性行爲訊息。

sentences.english: Tap the file you'd like to play to begin playback on your computer.
sentences.chinese: 點選你想要播放的文件可以開始在電腦上播放。

definition: take-out (fast food)/(outer part of) tire/as well/besides/into the bargain/outer zone
to make a choice (between several alternatives)/a choice/an option/an alternative
(at a restaurant) to order a meal/(of a waiter) to take an order
to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結賬|结账
to reserve a seat/to book a table/reservation
to eat in (at a restaurant) (Tw)/to take the medicine orally
to place an order/to order/an order (of goods)
